solution_line_template: She's replacing {num_cabinet_knobs} cabinet knobs for ${cost_per_cabinet_knob} each for a total of {num_cabinet_knobs}*{cost_per_cabinet_knob} = $<<{num_cabinet_knobs}*{cost_per_cabinet_knob}={total_cabinet_knob_cost}>>{total_cabinet_knob_cost}

She's replacing {num_drawer_pulls} drawer pulls for ${cost_per_drawer_pull} each for a total of {num_drawer_pulls}*{cost_per_drawer_pull} = $<<{num_drawer_pulls}*{cost_per_drawer_pull}={total_drawer_pull_cost}>>{total_drawer_pull_cost}

The cabinet knobs will cost ${total_cabinet_knob_cost} and the pulls will cost ${total_drawer_pull_cost} for a total of {total_cabinet_knob_cost}+{total_drawer_pull_cost} = $<<{total_cabinet_knob_cost}+{total_drawer_pull_cost}={total_upgrade_cost}>>{total_upgrade_cost} in upgrades
